p: Proteolytic production of the bacterial strains was assessed on protease casein medium that contained NA supplemented with 1% casein. One microliter of each isolate was pipetted on the plate and incubated at 28 °C for 5 days. The positive control was Bacillus cereus (ATCC 10102) while autoclaved distilled water served as a negative control. After incubation time, the clear zones due to casein hydrolysis were considered as an indication of protease production [ 27].
